newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toshiba launches IC card for electronic commerce.
newsitem.headline: Toshiba launches IC card for electronic commerce.

text.p: Toshiba Corp said on Wednesday it was launching a smart card for use as "digital cash" in electronic commerce, using cutting-edge data security technology.
The integrated circuit (IC) card, the CZ-3017, assures rapid encryption and decryption of highly secured data, the company said in a statement.
Toshiba said it started marketing the card on Wednesday, with samples available from April 1997. It will be marketed globally.
Mass production is scheduled to start in September 1997, with a base price of 1,000 yen, Toshiba said.
The latest edition to the CZ-3000 series, the CZ-3017 was developed specifically to address the need for highly secure, highly reliable cards suitable for electronic commerce, the company said.

Use of such advanced smart cards is surging, especially in financial applications, Toshiba said. Worldwide demand is forecast to reach 50 million units in the year to March 31, 1997, and to double to 100 million in 1997/1998, it said.
Last December Toshiba launched the CZ-3018 for use in ticketing, stored fees and telecommunications, the company said.
